item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "We live for books." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "We write to taste life twice, in the moment and in retrospect." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Jack Kerouac
item.description: "One day I will find the right words, and they will be simple." -- Jack Kerouac

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by E.L. Doctorow
item.description: "Writing is a socially acceptable form of schizophrenia." -- E.L. Doctorow

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Stories of imagination tend to upset those without one." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "A good bookshop is just a genteel Black Hole that knows how to read." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "This book was written using 100% recycled words." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "If you don't turn your life into a story, you just become a part of someone else's story." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Do you not know that a man is not dead while his name is still spoken?" -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "When in doubt, choose to live." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The truth isn't easily pinned to a page. In the bathtub of history the truth is harder to hold than the soap and much more difficult to find." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "The truth may be out there, but the lies are inside your head." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "I have no use for people who have learned the limits of the possible." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "No one is actually dead until the ripples they cause in the world die away..." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "WORDS IN THE HEART CANNOT BE TAKEN." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Books must be treated with respect, we feel that in our bones, because words have power. Bring enough words together they can bend space and time." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "People think that stories are shaped by people. In fact, it's the other way around." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "It is at this point that normal language gives up, and goes and has a drink." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Words are the litmus paper of the mind." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Susan says, don't get afraid, get angry." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by E.M. Delafield
item.description: "She is never alone when she has Her Books. Books, to her, are Friends. Give her Shakespeare or Jane Austen, Meredith or Hardy, and she is Lost - lost in a world of her own. She sleeps so little that most of her nights are spent reading." -- E.M. Delafield

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "let me live, love, and say it well in good sentences" -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Being a writer is a very peculiar sort of a job: it's always you versus a blank sheet of paper (or a blank screen) and quite often the blank piece of paper wins." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by James Michener
item.description: "I love writing. I love the swirl and swing of words as they tangle with human emotions." -- James Michener

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "The purpose of a writer is to keep civilization from destroying itself." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Stories may well be lies, but they are good lies that say true things, and which can sometimes pay the rent." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Isabel Allende
item.description: "Write what should not be forgotten." -- Isabel Allende

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Seanan McGuire
item.description: "I told them you almost certainly were not a serial killer, and that they were being horribly sexist by assuming that of the two of us, only you were capable of committing murder. That may have been a tactical error—it got me rather a lot more questioning that I hadn’t exactly been planning on.” “Well, yes. It’s usually unwise to tell the police you could be a serial killer if you really, really wanted to." -- Seanan McGuire

item.title: Stephanie add a quote by Frances Hodgson Burnett
item.description: "If you tell stories, you like nothing so much as to tell them to people who want to listen." -- Frances Hodgson Burnett
